description.narrative: Conservation-oriented management of forests and wetlands to achieve multiple benefits

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
Outcome I: 1.1. Number of business organizations involved in sustainable habitat management at target PAs that is profitable for them 1.2. Representation of women in sustainable use activities associated with business plans developed under Outcome 1 1.3. Area of natural, highly productive foraging grounds within the living territory of the European bison's micro population in the Nalibokski Reserve (50,000 ha) 1.4. Spatial distribution of bison throughout the micro population's living area 1.5. Area of open sedge mires where sustainable resource use and vegetation management is practiced 1.6. Dynamics of water level throughout the year 1.7. Population size of indicator species in Zvanets and Sporovsky Reserves 1.8. Area of open, sustainably used meadows at Turov and Pogost Meadows 1.9. Population size of species during spring migration (Widgeon, Ruff, Black-tailed godwit) 1.10. Population size of nesting indicator bird species (Great snipe, Black-tailed godwit, Terek sandpiper, Redshank) 1.11. Numbers of organized tourists in the PAs
Outcome 2: 2.1. Area of forest biotopes transferred to the protection category 2.2. Number of Forestries that envisage forestry management plans in line with sustainable use of protected biotopes 2..3 Number of employees of the Ministry of Forestry trained in the sustainable use of protected biotopes 2.4. Official policy and document on future use of forest hydro amelioration systems
Outcome 3: 3.1. Area of territory with associations of sedge mires 3.2.Population size of globally threatened species: Aquatic warbler, Greater spotted eagle, Curlew, Great snipe. 3.3. Area of restored sedge fen mires 3.4. Area of vegetation associations on restored mire 3.5. Greenhouse gas emissions at following pilot sites: 12,456 ha of forest peatland; 1,025 ha of open peatlands 3.6. Number of genetically valuable bison transferred from different micro populations in Belarus and Poland to Nalibokski to increase diversity 3.7. Number of genetic pass

comment.narrative:
Outcome I: 1.1. No business organizations involved in management of target PAs 1.2. 0% 1.3. Not more than 100 ha 1.4. During late autumn and early spring bison feed mainly on adjacent agricultural lands 1.5. Sporovsky 500 ha; Zvanets 100 ha 1.6. Unstable water level (30-50 cm above or 30 cm below ground level) during May-July; Water mineralization is from 300 to 450 mg/l 1.7. Species B/L pop. size: (i) Sporovsky Reserve (Aquatic warbler -500-700 males; Greater spotted eagle - 1-2 pairs); (ii) Zvanets Reserve (AW -2,100-4,400 males; Greater spotted eagle - 0-2 pairs; Curlew - 0-4 pairs) 1.8. Turov Meadow 100 ha; Pogost 0 ha 1.9. Species B/L pop. size: (i) Turov Meadow (Widgeon-10,000-20,000); Ruff - 10,000-30,000; Black-tailed godwit - 3,000); (ii) Pogost Meadow (W-100; Ruff - 0; Black-tailed godwit - 0) 1.10. Species B/L pop. size: (i) Turov Meadow (Great snipe-100 males); Black-tailed godwit- 30 pairs; Terek sandpiper - 5 pairs; Redshank- 120 pairs; (ii) Pogost Meadow (GS-0 males); BTG- 0 pairs; TS- 0 pairs; R- 0 pairs 1.11. Nalibokski -250; Sporovsky - 4,500; Turov Meadow - 340
Outcome 2: 2.1. 3,000 ha of forest lands with rare biotopes are transferred into protection 2.2. 3 forestry enterprises 2.3. Employees of the Ministry of Forestry do not have experience in sustainable use of rare biotopes needing special protection 2.4. Due to the lack of data for evaluation of the current state of forest hydro amelioration systems, there is no coordinated policy on their further use
Outcome 3: 3.1. Dikoe 250 ha; Servech 200 ha 3.2. Species B/L pop. size: (i) Dikoe- Aquatic warbler (150-200 males); Greater spotted eagle (4-5 pairs); (ii) Servech - AW- 31-38 males; Curlew - (0-2 pairs); Great snipe- (21-30 males) 3.3.There is only one sedge fen mire in the Grodno Region - the "Svisloch" mire – with an area of 200 ha 3.4. Sedge communities on the peatland Dokudovskoe (1,200 ha) occupy no more than 20 ha 3.5. Carbon dioxide emissions are about 10-20 tons per ha per year 3

Action plan on conservation of 13 invertebrates and 5 molluscs with EN and VU status based on scientific knowledge of size and distribution (including Dolomedes plantarіus, Dytіscus latіssіmus, Graphoderus bіlіneatus, Cerambyx cerdo, Lycaena helle, Lopіnga achіne, Euphydryas maturna, Phyllodesma ilicifolia, Unіo crassus, Pseudanodonta complanata)

Outcome 1: 1.1. Two (2) business organization involved in sustainable habitat management at two (2) target PAs (Mid-Pripyat and Servech reserves ); 1.2. Of the total number of experts hired by the project 26% were women (4 out of 15); 1.3. 430 ha of area of natural, highly productive foraging grounds in the Nalibоkski Reserve; 1.4. Due to an increase in productivity of natural forage habitats during the project implementation, the number of the Nalibokskaya population increased by 44.6% (from 83 to 120 stags in 2017-2021). At the same time, during this period, the proportion of bison that visit winter crops on agricultural lands decreased by 20% (from 70.5% to 50.8% in 2017-2021). 1.5. Sporovsky: 2,588 ha (mowing). Zvanets: 8090 ha (fire management, mowing).
1.6. Project monitors water levels at 8 points: - 2 on Zvanets bog - 3 on Sporoskoe bog - 2 on Dikoe bog - 2 on Servech bog
1.7. Sporovsky Reserve - Aquatic warbler : 100-150 singing males Greater spotted eagle: 1-2 pairs In 2021, there were very low water levels in the Sporovsky Reserve, which explains the low abundance of the Aquatic warbler
Zvanets Reserve: Aquatic warbler: population size will be determined after completion of translocation (preliminary determinations in the north and central parts of the reserve indicate density as above the average, in the south and east parts as medium or low densities) Greater spotted eagle: 3 pairs Curlew: 2-3 pairs In Zvanez reserve, the abundance of the Aquatic warbler will be estimated after counts during the second clutch period. Numbers are expected to be higher than in previous years due to optimal water levels.
1.8. Turov Meadow - 180 ha Pogost - 60 ha; 1.9. 2021 monitoring results for Turov Meadow Species: - Wigeon- 10,000-500; Ruff – 50,000-10,000; Black-tailed godwit -2,000-300
Pogost Meadow monitoring results: Widgeon: 500-0 Ruff : 1,000-0 Black-tailed godwit: 50-0.
1.10. Turov Meadow Species: Great snipe -20-30; Black-tailed godwit - 30-45; Terek sandpiper - 1; Redshank – 80-120
Pogost Meadow: Great snipe 0 Black-tailed godwit 0-1 Terek sandpiper 0 Redshank 2-5
1.11. Nalibokski – 2,300 Sporovsky – 1,228 Turov Meadow – 920 (source: Reports of target PAs to the National Statistic Committee
The decline in the number of tourists in the reserves is caused by the COVID 19 pandemic and anti-epidemic restrictions on public events
Outcome 2: 2.1.179,222.1 ha of forest lands with rare biotopes have been identified in 41 forestries during 2018-2021. Passports for the protection of 24,700.0 ha of rare biotopes outside protected areas were identified and agreed on with respective forestries; 2.2. 16 forestries envisage forestry management plans in line with sustainable use of protected biotopes. Forest management plans have been updated and approved for two (3) forestries: Dyatlovskoe, Ivievskoe and Stolinskoe. Also, project’s recommendations on necessary changes (to accommodate for sustainable use of biotopes) in management plans were prepared for thirteen (13) forestries. Revised plans for 13 forestries were prepared and submitted for approval to respective state bodies.
2.3. 110 employees total of forestries of the Ministry of Forestry have been trained since project start in the sustainable use of protected biotopes. 2.4. Proposals on ways of further use of forest hydro ameliorative systems on the area of 474,700 ha have been developed and agreed with the respective forestries (more than 104 forestries in 6 regions of the country). In 2021, the Project developed sectoral national program on sustainable use of hydroforestry reclamation systems, the program was passed to the Ministry of Forestry for consideration and adoption as legal sectoral act.
Outcome 3: 3.1. Dikoe - no changes from the baseline - 250 ha Servech - 600 ha were cleaned in 2018-2021 from bushes and reeds.
In 2021, works on optimization of the hydrological regime are undertaken at the Sevech fen, which will prevent overgrowth of the swamp with alder and birch on the whole lowland bog of 100 ha. 3.1. Dikoe - no changes from the baseline - 250 ha Servech - 600 ha were cleaned in 2018-2021 from bushes and reeds.
In 2021, works on optimization of the hydrological regime were undertaken at the Sevech fen, which prevented overgrowth of the swamp with alder and birch on the whole lowland bog of 100 ha.
3.2. 2021 monitoring results for: - Dikoe: Aquatic warbler - 50 males; Greater spotted eagle - 4-5 pairs; Long-term population trend of Aquatic warbler at Dikoe is decreasing due to the overgrowth of open marshes with bushes, in the short term, precipitations cause its population size to fluctuate to a greater degree. Servech: Aquatic warbler - 22-57 males; 3.3. 1020 ha of sedge fen mires (85% of EoP) have been restored by the project. 3.4. Mapping of vegetation in the Dokudovskoe peatland rewetted in 2020 (950 ha) was conducted in July-August 2021. 3.5. Ecological rehabilitation of 5 disturbed peatlands on the area of 12,567 ha was carried out, a total reduction in GHG emission calculated as appr. 125 000 tons per year. 3.6. On the basis of the developed and agreed scientific-methodical recommendations, the main principle of improvement of genetic diversity of the Naliboki population was the introduction of bison representing lowland lineage and inhabiting Western Europe. However, due to the current epidemiological and political situation, currently it is impossible to realize it 3.7. Based on the results of the study of the genetic status of the Naliboki micropopulation, 9 genetic passports for bison were prepared 3.8. In 2018 2020, 100 chicks were relocated from the Zvanets Reserve (Belarus) to the Zhuvintas Reserve (Lithuania). Of these, 22 birds returned in 2021 to the Zhuvintas Reserve after wintering. 3.9. 21 breeding pairs of greater spotted eagle were observed in Olmay Mires in 2021.
3.11. - 14 in the Olmany bogs; - 22 in the Zvanets reserve; - 6 in the Sporovski reserve 3.10. Breeding success significantly determined by population pressure of the White-tailed Eagle (there were repeated cases of eating chicks by the White-tailed Eagle). The number of White-tailed Eagles is steadily increasing in this region. As a mechanism for controlling the number of the white-tailed eagle, proposals are being prepared to remove this species from the Red Book of the Republic of Belarus 3.12. National action plans for 11 species (Numenius arquata, Haematopus ostralegus, Gallinago media, Lymosa lymosa, Cerambyx cerdo, Osmoderma barnabita, Unio crassus, Astacus astacus, Dolomedes plaptarius, Nehalennia acciosa, Pseudanodonta complanata) were developed and submitted for approval to the Ministry of Environment.
